coredata.dc:title: Layout design of manufacturable quantum-dot cellular automata

abstract.ce:para: Quantum-dot cellular automaton (QCA) is an emergent technology that is not hindered by quantum effects that limit the scaling of CMOS technology, but instead employs them to perform computation. However, this brings its own impediments, such as the influence of the thermodynamic effects. Beside that, QCA has to be coupled with CMOS circuitry of different size features to enable clocking. We discussed all these facts and devised a floorplan which would facilitate manufacturability. Based on it we developed the process of QCA layout design and defined the design rules that must be considered in order to ensure correct operation. These instructions enable the automatization of designing a QCA circuit layout. © 2012 Elsevier Ltd.

subject-areas.subject-area: Atomic and Molecular Physics, and Optics

item-info.copyright: Copyright 2012 Elsevier B.V., All rights reserved.

citation-title.titletext: Layout design of manufacturable quantum-dot cellular automata

affiliation.organization: Faculty of Computer and Information Science
Faculty of Computer and Information Science

abstract.ce:para: Quantum-dot cellular automaton (QCA) is an emergent technology that is not hindered by quantum effects that limit the scaling of CMOS technology, but instead employs them to perform computation. However, this brings its own impediments, such as the influence of the thermodynamic effects. Beside that, QCA has to be coupled with CMOS circuitry of different size features to enable clocking. We discussed all these facts and devised a floorplan which would facilitate manufacturability. Based on it we developed the process of QCA layout design and defined the design rules that must be considered in order to ensure correct operation. These instructions enable the automatization of designing a QCA circuit layout. © 2012 Elsevier Ltd.
